author: Albert Einstein
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Maya Angelou
text: If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude.

author: Walt Disney
text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: It always seems impossible until it's done.

author: Steve Jobs
text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do.

author: Mark Twain
text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: John Lennon
text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.

author: Confucius
text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Isaac Newton
text: If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.

author: Aristotle
text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

author: Helen Keller
text: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: J.K. Rowling
text: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.

author: Vincent van Gogh
text: I dream my painting, and then I paint my dream.

author: Marcus Aurelius
text: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Lao Tzu
text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

author: Abraham Lincoln
text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

author: Henry Ford
text: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't – you're right.

author: William Shakespeare
text: To be, or not to be, that is the question.

author: Charles Dickens
text: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.

author: Confucius
text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
text: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: Learning never exhausts the mind.

author: Steve Jobs
text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.

author: Abraham Lincoln
text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.

author: Mark Twain
text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.

author: T.S. Eliot
text: Do I dare disturb the universe?

author: Walt Disney
text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

author: Confucius
text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one’s ignorance.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.

author: Maya Angelou
text: We may encounter many defeats, but we must not be defeated.

author: Albert Einstein
text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.

author: Charles Darwin
text: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: I never lose. I either win or learn.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.

author: Helen Keller
text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
text: I have a dream that one day every valley shall be exalted, every hill and mountain shall be made low, the rough places will be made plain, and the crooked places will be made straight, and the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: Do you want to know who you are? Don’t ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.

author: John F. Kennedy
text: Ask not what your country can do for you – ask what you can do for your country.

author: Lao Tzu
text: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.

author: Aristotle
text: The more you know, the more you realize you don’t know.

author: Buddha
text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

author: J.K. Rowling
text: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.

author: Vincent van Gogh
text: I am seeking. I am striving. I am in it with all my heart.

author: Abraham Lincoln
text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
text: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
text: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: Learning never exhausts the mind.

author: Emily Dickinson
text: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.

author: William Shakespeare
text: All the world’s a stage, and all the men and women merely players.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

author: Charles Dickens
text: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.
